creator: BLASTFEMI
title: Easy Artistic Dye Technique using Microwave Oven
materials_required: Silk clothing, scarves, handkerchiefs, skein silk, yardage, silk socks or undergarments
Unsweetened powdered drink mix, Easter egg dye, or liquid food coloring
description: This project describes a fast and easy dye technique using a microwave to create artistic-looking, homemade, ready-to-wear silk clothes or accessories.
steps: Gather supplies: microwave safe bowl, colander or strainer, wooden skewer, optional rubber gloves, dye, microwave, drying rack, silk. Wet the silk and choose your dyeing technique.

Choose a dyeing technique: 1) Lay wet silk on plastic wrap, sprinkle with dye powder, roll into a 'sausage' and twist the ends, then place in a microwave-safe bowl. 2) Place wet silk directly into hot water with dissolved dye, tied or untied as desired. Fill the bowl with enough hot dye water to cover the silk. Use a skewer to submerge and top with a microwave-safe saucer to hold the fiber in the dye bath, if needed.

Microwave in 1 minute intervals, checking in between each minute, for a total of 5-7 minutes depending on the size of the project. The fiber has taken up most of the dye, it will still take up dye as it cools until the water is almost clear.

Cool on the counter. Once cooled to room temperature, unroll the plastic, if used, and rinse the silk briefly under warm to cold water. Drain and dry on hangers or a drying rack, out of direct sunlight. Optionally, iron carefully with a hot iron.
